headline: Trump says US will help tractor makers by removing environmental rules
summary: STORY: :: Trump says the U.S. will remove environmental rules to 'help' tractor companies:: December 8, 2025"We're going to also give the tractor companies, John Deere and all of the companies that make the equipment, we're going to take off a lot of the environmental restrictions that they have on machinery. It's ridiculous. I know because I buy a lot of that machinery for different things. We have a lot of big clubs with, you know, hundreds of thousands of acres. And I buy a lot of stuff and you buy it, it's got so much equipment on it for the environmental, it doesn't do anything except it makes the equipment much more expensive and much more complicated to work. And it's not as good as the old days. And we're going to take a lot of that nonsense off of the equipment, which is going to reduce. And we're going to do it, and we're going to say, 'you're going to reduce the prices.' We're not going to do it and they're not going to reduce, they're going to have to reduce their prices because farming equipment has gotten too expensive." "We're going to also give the tractor companies, John Deere and all of the companies that make the equipment, we're going to take off a lot of the environmental restrictions that they have on machinery. It's ridiculous," Trump said at a White House roundtable where he announced aid to farmers hit by his tariff policies.

raw.headline: Trump says US will help tractor makers by removing environmental rules
raw.summary: STORY: :: Trump says the U.S. will remove environmental rules to 'help' tractor companies:: December 8, 2025"We're going to also give the tractor companies, John Deere and all of the companies that make the equipment, we're going to take off a lot of the environmental restrictions that they have on machinery. It's ridiculous. I know because I buy a lot of that machinery for different things. We have a lot of big clubs with, you know, hundreds of thousands of acres. And I buy a lot of stuff and you buy it, it's got so much equipment on it for the environmental, it doesn't do anything except it makes the equipment much more expensive and much more complicated to work. And it's not as good as the old days. And we're going to take a lot of that nonsense off of the equipment, which is going to reduce. And we're going to do it, and we're going to say, 'you're going to reduce the prices.' We're not going to do it and they're not going to reduce, they're going to have to reduce their prices because farming equipment has gotten too expensive." "We're going to also give the tractor companies, John Deere and all of the companies that make the equipment, we're going to take off a lot of the environmental restrictions that they have on machinery. It's ridiculous," Trump said at a White House roundtable where he announced aid to farmers hit by his tariff policies.

headline: Impact of Trump's $12B farmer bailout: Deere exec. weighs in
summary: US President Trump unveiled a $12 billion aid package for farmers to help offset the impacts of tariffs and inflation. Deere & Company's president of the worldwide agriculture and turf division, Deanna Kovar, sits down with Yahoo Finance anchors Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton on Market Domination to explain what the aid means for the company's customers, the state of the agriculture industry, and more. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Deere’s Aggressive Business Goals Land With a Thud
summary: How a stock reacts to management proclamations can say a lot about what investors are thinking.  Take agricultural machinery maker  Deere  It hosted an investor event, laying out some bold targets.  After an initial bout of euphoria, investors eased off.

headline: Trump Will Give Farmers $12 Billion. The Stocks That Could Get a Boost—Ones That Won’t.
summary: President Donald Trump is going to help American farmers.  It might not help American investors, though—shares of agricultural equipment makers were falling after his remarks.  Monday, Trump announced $12 billion in aid to U.S. farmers, who are beset by rising costs and trade uncertainty, including $11 billion in “bridge” payments.

headline: Trump Urges Tractor Makers to Cut Costs as Vexed Farmers Get Aid
summary: Trump said Monday that his administration would give companies such as Deere & Co. permission to “take off a lot of the environmental restrictions that they have on machinery,” blaming them for driving up costs for farmers.  “They’re going to have to reduce their prices because farming equipment has gotten too expensive, and a lot of the reason is because they put these environmental excesses on the equipment, which don’t do a damn thing except make it complicated,” the president said.

raw.headline: Trump Urges Tractor Makers to Cut Costs as Vexed Farmers Get Aid
raw.summary: Trump said Monday that his administration would give companies such as Deere & Co. permission to “take off a lot of the environmental restrictions that they have on machinery,” blaming them for driving up costs for farmers.  “They’re going to have to reduce their prices because farming equipment has gotten too expensive, and a lot of the reason is because they put these environmental excesses on the equipment, which don’t do a damn thing except make it complicated,” the president said.

headline: 1 S&P 500 Stock to Keep an Eye On and 2 That Underwhelm
summary: While the S&P 500 (^GSPC) includes industry leaders, not every stock in the index is a winner. Some companies are past their prime, weighed down by poor execution, weak financials, or structural headwinds.
